metadata.title: CVE-2017-13695 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - negligible
metadata.description:
The acpi_ns_evaluate() function in drivers/acpi/acpica/nseval.c in theLinux kernel through 4.12.9 does not flush the operand cache and causes akernel stack dump, which allows local users to obtain sensitive informationfrom kernel memory and bypass the KASLR protection mechanism (in the kernelthrough 4.9) via a crafted ACPI table.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-13695` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-130-generic - 4.4.0-130.156
linux-image-4.4.0-130-generic-lpae - 4.4.0-130.156
linux-image-4.4.0-130-lowlatency - 4.4.0-130.156
linux-image-4.4.0-130-powerpc-e500mc - 4.4.0-130.156
linux-image-4.4.0-130-powerpc-smp - 4.4.0-130.156
linux-image-4.4.0-130-powerpc64-emb - 4.4.0-130.156
linux-image-4.4.0-130-powerpc64-smp - 4.4.0-130.156
linux-image-extra-4.4.0-130-generic - 4.4.0-130.156
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1092-raspi2 - 4.4.0-1092.100
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1095-snapdragon - 4.4.0-1095.100
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1062-aws - 4.4.0-1062.71
No subscription required

linux-image-4.15.0-34-generic - 4.15.0-34.37~16.04.1
linux-image-4.15.0-34-generic-lpae - 4.15.0-34.37~16.04.1
linux-image-4.15.0-34-lowlatency - 4.15.0-34.37~16.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-34-generic - 4.15.0-34.37~16.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-34-lowlatency - 4.15.0-34.37~16.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1023-azure - 4.15.0-1023.24~16.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1019-gcp - 4.15.0-1019.20~16.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1029-kvm - 4.4.0-1029.34
No subscription required

linux-image-4.15.0-1030-aws - 4.15.0-1030.31~16.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1007-oracle - 4.15.0-1007.9~16.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: linux package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-130.156').
linux-goldfish: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needed').
